intro: Racinaea subalata, commonly known as the alpine racinaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often on rocky slopes or in cloud forests. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, but its foliage is broad and often has a striking, waxy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Racinaea subalata is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
